intro: Tapirocarpus, commonly known as the horned tapirocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like structures on its stems. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Tapirocarpus is often found in humid, lowland forests where it thrives in partial shade. Its unique morphology and ornamental flowers make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
